adjective.description: Entomology. Having an ocellated eyespot with a contrasting central spot resembling the pupil of an eye; (of an eyespot) having a central pupil (sometimes, of a specified colour). Now rare.
With modifying word: designating or having eyes with pupils of a specified type.

origin: Early 19th century. From pupil + -ed, in sense 1 perhaps after scientific Latin pupillatus pupillate.
